snippet: Under the settlement with Florida regulators, the insurer will limit to $200 a month what patients have to pay for some commonly prescribed drugs..
abstract: Cigna agrees to reduce out-of-pocket costs that patients in Florida must pay for HIV drugs, settling complaint filed by advocacy groups who said drug pricing system in state's health care plans was discriminatory.
lead_paragraph: Under the settlement with Florida regulators, the insurer will limit to $200 a month what patients have to pay for some commonly prescribed drugs..

headline.main: Cigna Agrees to Reduce H.I.V. Drug Costs for Some Florida Patients
headline.print_headline: Cigna Agrees to Reduce H.I.V. Drug Costs for Some Florida Patients
